dialogues.speaker: GEORGIE
dialogues.text: May we have balloons?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Of course we can. Let’s go. The family run across the grass.

dialogues.speaker: BEFORE LIFE MAKES US GROW
dialogues.text: THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP They approach the Balloon Lady.  119

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (Holds out coins:) Hello - we would like some of your very finest balloons, please.

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: That you shall have. But choose carefully, my dearie ducks. Many have chosen the wrong balloon - be sure to choose the one that’s right for you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Which one would you like, Georgie?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIE
dialogues.text: Umm...

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go first, sir? Michael hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Me? Those days are long behind me. I don’t think I’ve held a balloon since I was a child.

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: Then you've forgotten what it’s like.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (Amused: ) To hold a balloon?

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: To be a child.

dialogues.speaker: YOUR HEART WILL TAKE FLIGHT
dialogues.text: As Michael reaches inside the bundle, choosing a balloon:

dialogues.speaker: THEN YOUR HEART WILL TAKE WING
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP Everyone is stunned as the balloon slowly LIFTS MICHAEL I THE AIR.

dialogues.speaker: WITH A SHINY NEW TOY
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP

dialogues.speaker: AUNT JANE
dialogues.text: Michael!  120

dialogues.speaker: HAS ME WALTZING ON AIR
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP He looks back to Aunt Jane, overcome with joy: Jane - I remember! It’s all true! Every impossible thing we imagined with Mary Poppins - it all happened! Michael soars into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: WITH YOUR HEAD IN A CLOUD
dialogues.text: ONLY LAUGHTER’S ALLOWED AND THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP DOWN BELOW, GEORGIE, ANNABEL and JOHN each choose their o balloons and lift up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: WE’RE ZIGGING AND ZAGGING

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGIC INSIDE THE BALLOON
dialogues.text: Jack comes through the crowd to the Balloon Lady.

dialogues.speaker: IT LIVES ON AS HISTORY
dialogues.text: AND THAT’S AN IMPORTANT THING He sees Aunt Jane turn to look into the bundle for her ow ‘right’ balloon.

dialogues.speaker: FOR NOBODY KNOWS WHAT TOMORROW MAY BRING
dialogues.text: He picks out a balloon, offering it to her. JACK (cont'd) This one looks like you. Aunt Jane gazes into the balloon, smiles.  121

dialogues.speaker: AUNT JANE
dialogues.text: How do you know? And with that, Aunt Jane floats up into the air. Admiral and Binnacle come through the crowd, having watched this whole exchange.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL BOOM
dialogues.text: Don’t you lose her, son! Jack takes a balloon. As he floats off, calling back:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I won't, sir! Jack rises up in the air to float beside Aunt Jane.

dialogues.speaker: UP HERE IN THE BLUE
dialogues.text: IT’S A MARVELOUS VIEW!

dialogues.speaker: THE LOVELY LONDON SKY
dialogues.text: DOWN BELOW, Wilkins hesitantly approaches the Balloon Lad

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: Would you like to try one yourself, sir?

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Why not - I’ll give it a go.

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: Alright, love. Choose carefully. He chooses a balloon, but instead of lifting him in the a it slowly sinks to the ground. He looks to the Balloon La BALLOON LADY (cont'd) Well... ...THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP UP ABOVE, Ellen rises quickly into the air, passing the family.

dialogues.speaker: WELL I WON'T MAKE A FUSS
dialogues.text: (Flying straight up:)

dialogues.speaker: THE BANKS FAMILY
dialogues.text: (Grabbing her legs:)

dialogues.speaker: "ELLEN, BETTER LET US
dialogues.text: Gooding and Frye are up in the air - Frye holds a single balloon, while Gooding grips onto him for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP! BACK DOWN BELOW, the Admiral floats out of his wheelchair Binnacle rising up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL BOOM
dialogues.text: I’ve set sail! Chart a course, Mr. Binnacle!

dialogues.speaker: BINNACLE
dialogues.text: That I will, sir! UP ABOVE, the sky is filled with parkgoers, including Mis Lark and Willoughby, the Milkman and the Park Keeper...

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: IF YOUR DAY’S UP THE SPOUT WELL THERE ISN’T A DOUBT

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP
dialogues.text: AND IF YOU DON’T BELIEVE

dialogues.speaker: IT GETS HARDER TO FROWN
dialogues.text: AND WE’LL ALL HIT THE HEIGHTS

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S NOWHERE TO GO BUT UP
dialogues.text: 123 EXT. THE PARK —- CONTINUOUS Mary Poppins stands in the park, gazing at the people floating above, umbrella in hand and carpet bag at her si The Balloon Lady comes over.

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: Of course, the grown-ups will all forget by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MARY POPPINS
dialogues.text: They always do.

dialogues.speaker: BALLOON LADY
dialogues.text: Only one balloon left, Mary Poppins. I think it must be yours.

dialogues.speaker: MARY POPPINS
dialogues.text: I suppose it must. The Balloon Lady passes Mary Poppins the balloon - a red then leaves. Mary Poppins looks inside the balloon, and s an image of herself, looking very much as she always look She nods, satisfied. MARY POPPINS (cont'd) Practically Perfect in every way. As Mary Poppins gazes at the balloon, her own image fades instead, she sees Michael, Aunt Jane, Ellen and the child floating down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..to land on the street in front of their house.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Welcome home, everyone.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT JANE
dialogues.text: It’s nice to be back, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: It is - so nice. I never thought I'd feel this much joy and wonder ever again. I thought that door was closed to me forever. At that moment, A STRONG GUST OF WIND BLOWS, swirling che blossoms around them and THROWING THE FRONT DOOR WIDE OPE  124

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same wind sweeps across the park, cherry blossoms cascading down around Mary Poppins as well. Her balloon s from her fingers and swirls up into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children run excitedly into the house - which has bee fully restored to its former state. Ellen goes up the ste following the children inside.

dialogues.speaker: MARY POPPINS
dialogues.text: It’s time. She opens her umbrella, raises it up into the breeze and floats into the air... EXT. THE BANKS HOME —- CONTINUOUS As the last of the cherry blossoms fall, Aunt Jane looks at Michael and realizes the truth.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT JANE
dialogues.text: She's gone, hasn’t she, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (He nods. Quietly:) Thank you, Mary Poppins. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, having landed, his balloon tied on his bicycle, gla up at Mary Poppins. He tips his cap to her, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I won't forget, Mary Poppins... promise. “LOVELY LONDON SKY” - reprise JACK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: AND MAYBE SOON FROM UP ABOVE
dialogues.text: YOU’LL BE BLESSED SO KEEP ON LOOKING HIGH And with that, Jack climbs onto his bike and pedals off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Poppins floats high above the scene. She glances bac for just a moment, smiling, then soars off into the cloud BLACK OUT. THE END.  All rights reserved.
